snippet: A hospital in Ohio agreed to pay $3.9 million over allegations that doctors billed Medicare for unneeded heart procedures.
abstract: Group of doctors who performed unusually high rates of heart procedures on patients at EMH Regional Medical Center in Ohio agree to pay $541,870 to settle Justice Department accusations that some of the procedures were medically unnecessary; hospital will pay $3.9 million.
lead_paragraph: A hospital in Ohio agreed to pay $3.9 million over allegations that doctors billed Medicare for unneeded heart procedures.

headline.main: U.S. Settles Accusations That Doctors Overtreated
headline.print_headline: U.S. Settles Accusations That Doctors Overtreated
